chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
items.plainText: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

items.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
items.plainText: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

items.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
items.plainText: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

items.text: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
items.plainText: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

items.text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
items.plainText: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

items.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
items.plainText: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

items.text: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
items.plainText: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

items.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
items.plainText: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

items.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
items.plainText: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

items.text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
items.plainText: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

items.text: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
items.plainText: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

items.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
items.plainText: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

items.text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
items.plainText: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

items.text: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
items.plainText: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

items.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
items.plainText: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

items.text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
items.plainText: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

items.text: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
items.plainText: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

items.text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
items.plainText: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

items.text: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
items.plainText: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

items.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
items.plainText: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

items.text: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
items.plainText: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

items.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
items.plainText: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

items.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
items.plainText: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

items.text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
items.plainText: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

items.text: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
items.plainText: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

items.text: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
items.plainText: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

items.text: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
items.plainText: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

items.text: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
items.plainText: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

items.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
items.plainText: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

items.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
items.plainText: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

items.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
items.plainText: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

items.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
items.plainText: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

items.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
items.plainText: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

items.text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
items.plainText: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

items.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
items.plainText: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
